subject: Re: Family hour around the radio
author: babiarz3
full_text:
Bill, 
I too can be idealistic and am usually dumbfounded by some of the
things that happen within the paranormal community. But, for whatever
reason, I am not idealistic when it comes to the possibilities of the
distribution of the box to whoever has the money to pay for one.
IMO, this reeks of money over-riding responsibility. This is a huge
step-forward in our field and I applaud the research and abilities
being shown. 
Like absolutely attracts like. And, as we all know, egos abound in
this field. The energies present when the box is turned on has a huge
effect on who comes through. I know this to be true.
Now, I don't have a proposed answer to my dilemma. I do not know how
to regulate the people who purchase. The only answer I can come up
with is time. Time to fully research the possibilities. The possible
psychological effect on untrained users, scares me. And although I get
that the onus of responsibility ultimately falls on the owner of the
box, I can't help but feel the responsibility falls on all of us. True
professionalism, I believe, would have the builders and distributers
testing the units over a period of time, at the very least. I'm pretty
sure Frank didn't call everyone on day one. 

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psi_research" <vilhellm@...> wrote:
>
> Hello all, although I didn't anticipate the direction this thread has
> gone, it is an important subject. There are those in the physical and
> non-physical planes that do not have the best intentions. It is
> unfortunate and sometimes I am idealistic and wish the world would be
> a place where everyone can work, live, and research together. But
> that's not the way it always is.
> 
> I was brought up in a wonderful home where the possibility of the
> existence of supernatural beings was accepted by my parents. Now,
> decades later, in our home we also accept this possibility and our
> kids, even though grown, are making up their own minds. The research I
> do is not taken lightly but we attract those that have similar values
> to our own. Even in the spirit world. This technology that Frank has
> brought forth is another form of ITC, and anyone with a video camera
> and tv can engage in video ITC. I don't think it would be possible to
> regulate who can have a camera and tv, just as we can't regulate who
> has access to any other technology including radios.
> 
> It's more of a matter of personal responsibility instead of the means
> we use to communicate. 
> -Bill
